placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text:
Upon arrival in Sri Lanka my husband filled in his immigration card with Buckingham ‘Palace’ as the address. This wasn’t completely wrong as we were treated like royalty from the second we arrived. 

The things that stand out the most: 

A beautiful property, very clever design so each room is private, gorgeous pools and restaurant. Incredible beach right there (no swimming) but we did walk 15 mins to a swimming section - or tuk tuk 20
mins to many big swimming beaches (I recommend Silent beach) Lovely scenic views and wildlife all around - peacocks, monkeys and birds.

Our room was huge, the size of an apartment, with a really comfortable bed. The extra bed for our teenage daughter was also a proper bed (not the usual fold away camp bed provided by some hotels). The toiletries in the bathroom were amazing - try them. The nicest shampoo etc. The room was super clean. We slept so well every night. 

The food! My favourite part! This was just incredible! The breakfast menu has so many great options and you can order as much as you wish - included in the room price. Honestly the best breakfast I have ever had in a hotel in 48 years of travelling. Our favourites were the fresh juices (so fresh) the spicy eggs and the French toast!  Every single thing we ate we loved and for one dinner I had a crab and mango curry which was truly exceptional. The food is all 5* Coffee is free before and during breakfast and is great, we had it delivered fresh to our room each morning pre breakfast. Drinking water is free 24/7. 

The service - wow! We were treated like royalty. Every question was answered, every request was instantly granted (thank you Kalpa the amazing manager a fountain of knowledge). The nicest, warmest group of staff they really make you feel like a VIP and genuinely care. The owner is a lovely, friendly guy and made sure we were happy throughout our stay. Also the ladies working outside gave us the warmest, friendliest smiles every time we passed, even in the distance they would wave and smile every time. 

The hotel will arrange a tuk tuk to take you out and about it’s very cheap and easy, we took one to the beach and back. He dropped and collected us and works for the hotel. There are nearby local restaurants within walking distance - but it’s very hard to resist the amazing hotel food. This hotel makes everything so easy for guests - the check in and out, the Tuk Tuk, the airport transfers, room cleaning (done when you give them the key at breakfast), extra coffee and water. I will be back and doubt I’ll ever stay anywhere else in Sri Lanka now I have stayed at Buckingham Place. Thank you BP.
title: Wow - just SO glad I chose to stay here!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '945931856', 'text': "Thank you for your valued custom, helpful feedback and kind compliment for me personally. I’m delighted your positive comments could include our dining and bar experience, and that your husbands’ prawns were the best in Sri Lanka.

Firstly, as yours is our lowest scoring Trip Advisor review in 4 years, we naturally regret that our long and lucky run is over! Moreover, I’m frustrated personally, that easily resolved niggles took the edge off your stay, and that which most guests define as the ‘luxury’ of Buckingham Place - its ethos and team, failed to shine through those niggles. Although your review is anonymous, I respectfully share my personal perspective, along with information copied directly from our website.
    
Hot water: “…solar panels heat bathroom water but the temperature fluctuates. Water takes a few moments to run hot, early morning and on overcast days it will run tepid. If this persists please say, we will switch on your back-up water heater.” All solar panels and are routinely checked and within warranty period, and, water temperature is tested by Housekeepers prior to guests occupying their accommodation. When made aware of a system malfunction we automatically rectify it – night or day. 
In room tea and coffee: “you may find this a little unusual but, it is for good reason! We avoid providing in-room brew facilities. Instead, we happily deliver fresh pots of tea and coffee and thus reduce temptation to ants and wildlife to share your accommodation. Please call from 07:00 for your pot of choice, or if you’re a punctual early riser simply request service the previous evening or on arrival. Unlimited tea and coffee is served from 07:00 and throughout breakfast.” 4 cup pots of tea after breakfast, billed at $5 ($1.37 per cup) include VAT @18%, service charge, government levies and taxes - c32% in all. In the event of solo tea drinkers the team is trained to provide a cup and saucer and adequate tea/milk for 2 cups, and to bill @50%. Also, by exception, we happily provide brew facilities whenever asked. If we have overcharged or failed to communicate I apologize unreservedly, please email me with details so we can reimburse you.
     
Turtles: “Buckingham Place is situated on the edge of a nature sanctuary and prime nesting beach for sea turtles. During daylight hours, beach visitors can roam freely and if lucky, witness turtle hatchlings heading for the sea. After dark, for the sake of nesting turtles, beach access is necessarily supervised by wildlife rangers and village nest-protectors who operate a night-watch project funded by visitor donations.” We advise guests to the best of our knowledge, that sea turtle nesting occurs predominantly February – July. I’m pleased to say, turtle activities and positive experiences have been as plentiful as we’ve known since opening the hotel in 2010. Unfortunately, not everyone is so lucky. Early on in the nesting season turtle arrivals can be a bit hit and miss I'm afraid. 
  
A welcome email (from me) is sent to every guest, I quote this excerpt “…we are friendly, informal and as helpful as can be, and our ethos, everything is meant to be perfect nothing is too much trouble is genuinely heartfelt. We will try to anticipate your needs but please, tell us if we haven’t or if anything concerns you. If we can make you happier or more comfortable in any way – just say the word.” 
The team works tirelessly, without complaint in our language and culture, but its members are no less approachable, helpful, intuitive or resourceful when the need arises. One need only ‘say the word’ at the time.

Again, thank you for your valued custom and helpful feedback. I hope us daring to be different from the mainstream makes sense, and that perhaps you’ll return one day and see us in a better light. I hope too, that your memory of Buckingham Place is a fond one for many years to come, and wish you a happy and healthy life always.

Best wishes,

Nick & the Team      
", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-04-09', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text: This is a well appointed hotel run by an ex- pat Englishman, the personable Nick Buckingham. I would describe it as ideal for anyone wanting the universal resort style accommodation and facilities: the infinity pool outside the dining area, the billiards room, the decor , the presentation of the rooms.  There is a garden pool which is lovely for a less public bathe. A spa is onsite and I enjoyed the pedicure. There is a good range of cocktails and the dining is excellent: my husband had the best prawns of the trip. No spoiler alert, but there is a special touch to the dining experience. It was disappointing to have no hot water in the shower. It also seemed very odd to have no tea/ coffee making facility in the room: this is most uncommon, and certainly the only place in Sri Lanka to lack it. I was told I could order tea any time, day or night, but this is not quite the same, especially when I saw we had been charged US$5.00 for every cup I had. There is a pleasant walk along the beach, but we did not get to see the turtles nesting.
title: Luxury resort near Tangalle.

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text:
Exceptional!  I’ve spend my life travelling overseas on biz and for pleasure.  I’ve never encountered such a well run hotel with such well-trained staff.
You will be met on arrival by the hotel manager (the gate keeper checks yr name and buzzes the manager who is there waiting for you). He spends 1/2 hour showing you around. From then on you immediately feel at home. 
Owner, Nick Buckingham runs the show quietly from his ‘view-all’ seat, and he misses nothing.  From the little gestures of cool drinks served to all sunbathers at the pool at midday, to having a glass of water handed to you as you return from the beach- and always two of the dinning room staff to pull back your chairs.  My wife had a sneezing fit one day (a frequent event), and a box of tissues were slipped quietly onto our table.  The hand towels in the toilets near the pool, were always turned down with a small flower on them.  Try moving one of your pool deck-chairs on your own - you’ll never get away with it, as one or two of the observant staff will politely shoo you away - and do it for you! 

Fresh flowers every day around the hotel.  Posters were hung for guests birthdays (as well as a cake of course) - and ‘Welcome back’ posters for returning guests, of which I would expect there must be many.  We even had a cake on our final evening with ‘Thank you for your visit’ scribed on the top.
The bar area is deliberately small and intimate, which encourages social interaction - of which there is much.  We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 week stop, longer than I’ve probably ever stayed in a hotel anywhere. The guests came from everywhere - which made socialising interesting.

The food is of the highest standard. Personally, I have a simpler taste, but there was nearly always something to suit me while my wife tucked in to more exotic dishes. 

This is the first time I’ve ever given full marks to a hotel. Nick’s team deserve it - they are really quite exceptional.  They are all a very cheery team, and will always stop for a chat.  And then, on the sad occasion that you have to leave this paradise, the staff all line up to wish you a Bon Voyage.  Where else have you ever seen that?  It makes departure all the harder! 

We’ll be back one day!  Thank you ‘team Buckingham’

P.S. They also supply Marmite (and Vegemite for our cousins from ‘down under’)
title: “Simply the best”

roomTip: Book for longer than you initially planned - you will not regret it.
text:
Nestled along the sun-kissed shores of South Sri Lanka, Buckingham Place and Spa stands as a beacon of serenity in a tropical paradise. From the moment you arrive, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of unparalleled excellence and genuine hospitality. Every aspect of this boutique gem, from its lush gardens to its inviting poolside with sun deck and swim up bar, exudes a sense of tranquility and sophistication.

At Buckingham Place and Spa, every guest is treated to a private sanctuary, with our own accommodation being a spacious suite with excellent views over the lagoon and a unique open roof shower experience. Toiletries provided were a lovely touch and were topped up daily along with the mini fridge. We enjoyed the resident peacocks strutting around, even with the early wake up calls and were treated to many evenings entertainment with monkeys playing in the trees around us. 

The culinary delights of Buckingham Place and Spa have been a gastronomic journey to remember. Each evening brings a new menu which has been carefully curated to cater to every palate. From local delicacies to international classics executed with their own little twist we never struggled to find something that we would like to eat and we were loyal patrons every evening as there is nothing else locally that can touch the quality of the food that is served. Even being slightly fussy at times was met with flexibility from the kitchen staff. 
And it's not just about the taste; the presentation of each dish is a work of art, reflecting the same attention to detail found throughout the hotel. Additionally, the innovative "lazy breakfast" concept allows guests to rise at their leisure and still enjoy a freshly cooked breakfast every morning. We took full advantage of this and attempted to try everything we could off the menu! Thank you kitchen staff!

However, what truly sets this boutique apart is its exceptional team of dedicated staff. From the smiling gardeners, the patient tuk tuk drivers and the meticulous housekeepers to the front of house team every member of the Sri Lankan team are united in the spirit of personalised service. Special mentions to Commander Deepal (we promoted you!) and Ruwan who ran steady ships each meal time; Heshan, Dilshan, Niluka, Nudun who always served us with a smile, Harshana who brought us countless room services, Ashan for his amazing smile (and the cake!) and Aruna for all the cocktails and wine recommendations (we will miss your wit!). We also need to thank Chamindu for rescuing us twice when we were lost and also sorted out various things for us around the hotel and the wonderful Umesh for his knowledge and kindness throughout our stay (keep up the physio!)

Our biggest thank you has to go to the oracle himself Mr. Kalpa who was on hand even before our arrival with sorting our transfers and answering our ridiculous questions. This gentleman has the patience of a saint and a wonderfully dry sense of humour! Every single member of the team ensured that every aspect of our stay was tailored to our preferences. 

Buckingham Place and Spa isn't just a hotel; it's a destination where luxury meets authenticity, and every detail is curated with care. Whether you're lounging by the pool, indulging in a delectable meal at the on-site restaurant, or rejuvenating your senses at the spa, every moment is crafted to exceed your expectations. The genius behind this creation can be found sitting in the bar most days and often engaging guests in conversation most evenings. His ethos and care shines is all aspects of Buckingham place and we were honoured to have spent many a morning and evening chatting to the wonderful owner, Nick. 

If you're seeking a peaceful retreat or an adventure-filled getaway, this boutique oasis offers an unforgettable experience that leaves you longing to return
title: Simply perfection in a tropical paradise

ownerResponse:
{'id': '944747982', 'text': "Pretty perfect yourselves...

Thank you for choosing Buckingham Place and, for your valuable good custom and awesome review. 

Every guest stay and great review are highly prized. Reviews inspire fellow travelers, keep us on track and don’t let us rest on our laurels. At the outset a fellow hotelier told me, ‘you’re only as good as your last review’ – so far we’ve been blessed! 

Every review highlights a positive not mentioned before or recently, as yours does. Mr. Nick’s Tip System as its known, has proven hugely popular both with the team and our guests. For most travelers, how much to tip, who to pay and when, is a headache we don't need. To be frank, distribution of gratuities at many hotels tends to favor front of house staff and be unfair to back of house crews working equally hard. One day I hope, our industry will adopt our initiative as the norm. For now, I am delighted you approve and have said so, and include it with praise for just about everything else we do.          

You felt welcome because you were - you were pretty perfect yourselves! Needless to say, it would be our pleasure and a privalege to host you again so I hope you return. In the meantime, thank you for your support and, please keep telling the world Sri Lanka (and our hotel) is good to go!

Warm regards and respect

Nick & the Team

text:
Amazing staff, excellent food, superb location. The perfect place to relax at the end of a 3 week tour of Sri Lanka. 

Right next to the most amazing beach! Swimming pool is lovely! The cocktails are so good! Breakfast is a la carte with a varied choice - all delicious. Food is available all day and was always top notch. It’s very chilled here, we loved it. 

An additional great thing for us was that you only tip at the end of your stay … and the tips get distributed amongst all staff. 

We chose to book a  secluded room with a lovely deck and inside / outside shower and bath. Beds are very comfortable. 

Sincere thanks to everyone for making us feel so welcome and at home.
title: Pretty Perfect!

It’s all true! I was certainly a little sceptical prior to arrival, as I had never seen such good reviews for a hotel, anywhere. But Buckingham Place gets it so right. How? text: A great place in which to unwind after a busy Sri Lankan itinerary. Friendly with a relaxed vibe, superb service, good food and ever smiling staff.  Great to listen to the owner, Nick's, anecdotes. Large rooms in standalone villas bedecked with colour and paintings by a local artist.  Access to a near empty beach, but no sea swimming - it's far too rough!  The swimming pool has splendid ocean views though. Highly recommended.
title: A Place to unwind.

ownerResponse:
{'id': '943585677', 'text': 'Thank you very much for choosing Buckingham Place, and, for your high recommendation and helpful feedback on this forum. I’m delighted you found the hotel as we intend it to be, “A great place to relax” and that you enjoyed your stay. We did too, you were great sports and a part of the place for 5 days.
 
Your feedback is positive overall (thanks again) and you kindly recommend the hotel to those in your footsteps. However, clearly there were issues that niggled a bit, I only wish I’d been made aware of them at the time. Hot bathroom; this has been mentioned a few times over the years, usually on hot still days. Upon request, housekeeping install a stand fan which, we avoid leaving in situ due to rapid corrosion by the sea air. Being open to the elements it is impossible to air-condition bathrooms I’m afraid, so currently a stand fan is the only solution. Food; since our 2021 post-pandemic reopening, yours are the first observations of their kind to my knowledge. Contrarily, every day of the week diners tell me they enjoy and are satisfied with every meal and menu pricing, with regular and first time guests frequently asking for dishes they know well. c90% of our house guests take c95% of their meals with us while many rave about our kitchen. However, I do recognise tastes and expectations vary enormously and, I don’t allow ourselves to rest on our laurels. I wish we had satisfied you much more with your meals and say sorry fir not doing so. 

I could write at length on the dynamics of formal vs. informal sector pricing but I’ll spare you! Regrettably VAT@18%, taxes, levies on revenue (irrespective of profitability); annual inspection fees, permit renewals and liquor licensing, an obligatory 10% service charge, 50+ well paid, year-round jobs with workers compensation insurance, savings plans, pensions, meals, welfare and healthcare, and multi-million dollar investment, inevitably result in higher prices at mid/high end hotels - higher than a shack on a beach with none of the above. We frequently monitor pricing at equivalent establishments, we peg prices at/below ordinary bistros and gastro pubs in the UK and try insulating guests from the vagaries of currency exchange rates and a recovering economy. For example; taking note of the strengthening SL Rupee impacting international travelers, taking some by surprise, we recently returned to menu pricing introduced last season! Beach vegetation; the hotel is located within the boundary of a nature sanctuary and thus, controlled by strict laws pertaining to construction, operation, lighting, vegetation and the preservation thereof. For the protection of wildlife – most notably sea turtles, and to protect the property from coastal erosion, we happily observe relevant laws and have in fact, voluntarily set aside an acre of valuable beachfront land for re-greening. Our elevated facility, whilst not overlooking sand, does enjoy breath-taking panoramic ocean views whilst providing, direct access to the sand itself – and a nice surprise when one steps on it! 

I respect always, a guests’ perspective – thank you for yours. I hope you will reflect fondly on your stay for many years to come, and, return to Sri Lanka and the hotel one day; a hotel where everybody appreciates your valuable custom, kind recommendation  and excellent company. 
  
Warm regards,

Nick & the Team
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-03-24', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text:
We spent 5 nights here after travelling around Sri Lanka for nearly 2 weeks.
It's an excellent place to relax.  Our room was spacious with a good view of the lagoon.  The bedroom's aircon was excellent but the large bathroom was very hot as no fan or aircon.
The food was fine without being exceptional and we though quite expensive by Sri Lankan standards. After three evenings we ate out which we thought was more satisfactory and better value. There are several nearby local restaurants or one can take a 20 minute tuk tuk drive to Tangalle - the driver will wait for you all evening for about £7. 
There are two good pools  -  the large one in front of the restaurant and another smaller one in the garden behind which we and friends preferred. 
Swimming in the sea is not recommended due to rips etc but that goes for so many places in Sri Lanka. While there are sea views from the hotel and one hears the waves breaking, the nearby beach is  out of sight due to vegetation from the hotel. 
The owner Nick Buckingham was very much in evidence and he and his staff were very helpful.
We recommend Buckingham Palace (as our driver called it!) and enjoyed our stay,
title: A Great Place to Relax

text: This was our R& R hotel, and we stayed for four lovely nights. The decor is eclectic, the rooms are amazing, and the food is delicious. It's not pretentious, just a lovely place to eat and chill by the pool. A short walk through the gardens takes you to the beach, which is stunning to look at, but sadly too dangerous to swim in. (There are swimming beaches within a short drive.) We did go down one evening with the Turtle Watch team and saw turtle eggs being laid. There are little local restaurants in the village, which we used two of the nights. We also used the spa for massages, which were lovely! While we were there, a Hindu festival procession took place in a local town, which was very entertaining.  A wonderful stay, with lovely staff looking after you. Thank you Nick!
title: Heaven!

text:
It’s all True!
But even when you arrive with such high expectations  based on others recommendations , your expectations are exceeded!- (and some!)
It’s not really about the location (which is idyllic) or the rooms (which are huge, light and airy with fantastic Lagoon views inc Eagles and Kites etc) or the Beautiful Pool and  Wild  Undeveloped Beach  as far as the eye can see (Turtle Conservation Centre next door)  or the Food ( which will likely be the best you have had while in Sri Lanka) 
This place is all about the people. Impeccable service  with a genuine smile that I’m fairly confident could not be matched  even if you were staying somewhere that cost £10K a night. It’s the personal touches that will make you  feel like a King or Queen.
Nick  the live in owner has created something special and his staff have also bought into this.  Big shout out to Umesh  and Kalpa! - Thank you!
Sri Lanka is a Country full of amazing experiences. But if you stop  here to relax at the end of your stay the only regret  you’ll have is that you didn’t  stay longer. 
This is very possibly the best Hotel we have ever stayed at -irrespective of cost.
A soon as it is possible for us to return  we will be back for sure.
Danny and Donna.
title: Best of the Best Indeed!  - Special!

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text:
Finally, after geopolitical strife and the pandemic conspired to thwart us, we returned to Buckingham Place six years after our first visit. And it's just as good as we remembered.
We've been travelling and touring together now for 27 years and Buckingham Place is one of the two best places we've ever found - and the other best place sadly now no longer exists.
One of us had a "landmark" birthday during our stay and Kalpa, Umesh and the team put on a lovely birthday meal on the room veranda overlooking the lagoon including a specially made cake incorporating some favourite fruit.
At the helm is Mr Nick the engaging founder and owner without whom the
hotel wouldn't exist and literally wouldn't be Buckingham Place.
The hotel is situated on a strip of land on the south coast between Rekawa lagoon and the Indian ocean. Swimming is for the pools only as the sea here is wild and dangerous. It is also a wild uncommercialised beach where turtles lay their eggs and it is great for walking and exploring. There is access from the property directly onto the beach.
The hotel is ideal for nature watching - even more so for birdwatchers (which we're not really). Just sitting on our veranda we saw a troop of grey langurs (many of which posed obligingly for our cameras), peacocks, parakeets, bee eaters, brahmani kites, a mongoose, a mouse deer (we think) and lots of smaller mammals. There are also monitor lizards loping around.
If you like an active nightlife and the clubs, this place is not for you. But if you enjoy top notch food with attentive service in an outstanding setting, chatting with friends at the bar, abundant nature and relaxation then this is for you. 
We're already planning our third visit.
title: Let me consult the superlative factory..

text:
Buckingham Place found me…….
And I found my  Nirvana.
I can not put my finger on what makes Buckingham Place such a unique oasis.
Is it Nick, who owns Buckingham Place? 
……. always there but in an ethereal way, he doesn’t own this place, Buckingham Place IS Nick!
The Sri Lankan sunshine, skies,sparkling sea,the sand, coconut palms, lagoons, the birds, monkeys , wildlife everywhere you look and listen thier beauty  all personified here.
The beach at Rekawa… Paradise…. For us just to take a glimpse and soak up the magic, but most importantly home to the turtles… keep it that way.
The staff…. Every single one of them radiating Sri Lankan kindness, warmth, generosity, and discreetness, so much more than professionalism.
There is no hierarchy here….. every room beautifully understated spacious stylish personal relaxation space.
The tourism/hospitality industry is huge a vast array of so much…. How can you put a place like Buckingham place into a category?
Buckingham Place …. No tick boxes for me…. It is just what it is. And the difference is Buckingham Place has soul.
Nick/Buckingham Place,  you have taken away from me the dilemma of the search for my next  vacation…..Buckingham Place has me well and truly under its spell.
Thank you
Sally X
title: Under a Sri Lankan spell

text:
Buckingham Place is an absolute jewel.  We spent three nights at this amazing hotel after a tour of Sri Lanka.  While the website shows rather bright coloured buildings which we thought looked a little strange, on arrival you appreciate the wonderful effect of vibrant colours throughout.  Our room was very large with an amazing bathroom with an excellent bath and shower and a comfortable patio area.  The pool was large and immaculately clean.  In fact the whole hotel was gleaming.

Nick Buckingham was around most of the time chatting to guests and ensuring that everything was catered for.  He runs a very efficient and friendly establishment and is rightly proud of the hotel and his staff.  A charming man who obviously has great vision to have built such a  wonderful hotel.

All staff were very attentive and friendly - nothing was too much trouble.  The food was excellent and varied ranging from Sri Lankan curries to more Western type dishes.

I have no hesitation in giving Buckingham Place five stars it was superb in all respects.
title: Buckingham Place is an absolute jewel

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Sea swimming not advised.  The meal sizes are large - you might want to share!
text:
We have travelled widely across 5 continents and BP remains the best value hotel we have ever stayed at.  In February 2024 we stayed there again and the standard of accommodation, service and food was first class.  The ambiance of the place is heightened by the staff as well as by the guests who choose to stay there, many of them, like us, for the 2nd. 3rd or 4th time!  
The hotel is on the beach but like much of this side Sri Lanka it is unsafe to swim, however two excellent pools (one large and one small)  make up for this.  BP is quite isolated, it is part of a tranquil community; nearby there are two game reserves Yala and Udawalawe National Parks both within a two hour drive.  Whale watching and back-water bird watching is even closer. Galle is two hours away and the tea country is easily accessible.   However it is unlikely that you will want stray far from the hotel not least because the wildlife does have a habit of visiting you there.  Monkeys, peacocks, mongooses, squirrels, lizards and a plethora of bird life.
A final ‘stand out’ for us is the level of care that guests receive; travelling, especially so far from home, can bring with it any number of problems, but the staff at BP will always work to help you overcome any complications.  Led by Nick Buckingham (the owner) the team including Kalpa, Umesh and Chamadu are always on hand to help resolve any issues that might arise.  
Buckingham Place is simply the best!
title: Buckingham Place - Simply the Best!

text:
Buckingham Place is exceptional, a very special place, in fact unique in our experience.

The facilities are all first class. From the large, high quality villas with their amazing views to the delightful restaurant overlooking the large, tempting infinity pool, all surrounded by beautiful gardens. It’s just a short stroll to the a stunning, unspoilt beach and a bike ride or early morning canoeing will reveal the wonderful surrounding countryside.

But what makes Buckingham Place unique? The atmosphere generated by owner Nick & his amazing team makes you feel relaxed from the moment you arrive. Their ethos is totally centred on doing whatever is necessary to make every guest feel special & the team achieve this, 100% of the time, in a clam, understated way. Quite simply, we cannot recommend Buckingham Place  highly enough!

roomTip: Just go and experience the magic for yourself
text:
Buckingham Place, seems to have a magic that casts its spell on you the minute you arrive. We have always had a rule how ever good a hotel is, not to return as the next time around the edge has gone but not here, this is now our third visit and it just gets better and better. The hotel itself is set in the most spectacular surroundings, the 16 large and beautiful suites overlook the Lagoon, so while sitting on your balcony or terrace you have the company of birds of prey gliding on the thermals, monkeys having family time and magnificent Peacocks strutting their domain. You then have oceanfront where the restaurant, bar and infinity pool are housed, overlooking the sights and sounds of the Indian Ocean and from here you access the most beautiful unspoilt beach.
What sets BP apart from other places is its ethos and soul and this has been created by its owner Nick and his loyal team, the smiles and the warmth of everybody at BP are infectious. 
Friends came with us this time as we had praised BP so highly and there  is always a concern because we all don’t like the same things in life but after 2 weeks they didn’t want to leave and that says it all. The food here is excellent with the most amazing breakfast menu served between 8 and midday. The evening meal is based on a 5 day rolling menu and the quality and choice of Sri Lankan and Western cuisine is second to none.
Spa treatments are superb, bikes and canoes can be provided and day trips organised.
I celebrated my 60th Birthday at BP and wow a night I will truly cherish for the rest of my life, but it’s  the people at  BP that make this place so special. 
 Nick you truly are a very special man who has the most amazing team behind him.
We want to personally say a massive thank you to Kalpa, Umesh, Chamindu, Depal, Ashan, Aruna, Ruman, Niluka, Harshana, Heshan, Madushaka, Rohan, Nadun plus all the other members of the team in the kitchen, garden & housekeeping 
Until next time we thank you with all our hearts 
Dave & Kim
title: A little piece of heaven on Earth

ownerResponse:
{'id': '939556161', 'text': 'As good as they get..

I am left almost speechless this morning, after reading (and re reading!) your spectacular review. As I scratch my head wondering how to thank you adequately for it and realise I can’t, I can tell you how valuable your contribution is to sustaining 53 livelihoods with more planned. 

The hotel is a local business and tax payer; a local employer and trainer; purchaser and contractor of numerous local services and contributor to various community initiatives from time to time (when in the position to be). It supports a pre-school, a dog vaccination program and has uplifted its immediate environs over the years, simply by bring electricity and a waterline to its gates. Before Buckingham Place the village tank was its bathtub, most folk lived in mud houses and there were barely a handful of decent jobs in tourism. I have been amazed by the extent a small enterprise can contribute positively to a less than privileged community – often unintentionally. And, whilst I built the hotel for my own future rather than from any sense of altruism, I have been rewarded manifold by other positive outcomes.

Your good custom and kind words is how you have contributed. Without your support and that of others down the years, the hotel would simply not exist, plus, the 200 or so family members of my 53 strong team might not be faring as well. So I send thanks from us all for including us in your itinerary; following up magnificently here on Trip Advisor, and, for gracing us with your excellent company. Naturally we’d be over the moon to welcome you back but until then and always, I wish you a wonderful life.          

Thank you, your review is as good as they get.

Warm regards and respect

Nick & the Team

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Just read the reviews and decide if it is the style you are looking for.   Make sure you use the expertise of Nick, Umesh and Kalpa
text:
The previous reviews are all spot on - you really cannot fault this gorgeous little pearl of a place. Chiefly because Nick the owner in residence makes sure that you feel special and is a perfect host.  The team who work with him make this a great, relaxed, friendly experience - ensuring they can do as much as possible to make your trip feel like a really great visit to a place where you belong…rather than just a guest.   There are so many repeat guests it shows that if it works for you - you will be back again and again..   So it has a modern design and yet everyone has privacy and really comfortable rooms.      
Room:   We had a very large family room.   It was incredibly spacious, with a little fridge filled with some welcoming complimentary goodies.   No tea or coffee facilities in the room but the staff will deliver (free of charge tea to your room on request).   The bathroom is large, ours had a very big bath tub (which I didn’t us) and a lovely walk in shower.  There is a great emphasis on being environmental sensible - so lovely bottles are refilled for shower gel etc.   Air con worked well and the bed was comfortable with good pillows and nice linen.  Ironing board available on request.   
Laundry can be done and is quoted for per kg of weight but be aware you also have to pay for the tuk tuk driver to deliver it to the outsourced laundry - all came back beautiful pressed and no problems.    It was still quite reasonably priced.  Outside our room we had a very pleasant garden with a beautiful view of the lake/reservoir with an amazing array of birds and wildlife to watch.  
Setting:   The restaurant and pool faces towards the sea and the rooms generally face the lagoon.  The area around us had the lake as mentioned but also access to a beach where turtles lay their eggs and you can go and watch them being hatched and going into the sea, under controlled Turtle Hatcher support.   The beach on the hotel front is visible from the pool but is rather too wild to swim but within a 15 min walk you can swim in some rock pool areas.   There are plenty of little local eateries within walking distance either out onto the access road or along the beach.   There are a range of lakes within walking distance if you like bird watching - the local area is very friendly with everyone giving you a hello and a smile.    lots to see and do around - and I have already made a review separately of a conservation area that the team will arrange for you to go by tuk tuk and float on a raft with a guide to watch the bird life - and even if you are not a birder it is magical.  Plenty of other trip options to do and the team will help you with anything you want to do.   However, so much to enjoy at BP many fail to even venture out! 
Facilities:  So there is a the luscious large swimming pool with a good view of the beach, plus a smaller very quiet little pool in the grounds.   There is a spa and I had a very good massage in a simple room but very good value.   The restaurant and bar are superb and the menu options are always plentiful,, interesting and a real treat. So much so that we ate there every night. Breakfasts are superb and individually cooked.  Little lounge area by the bar where everyone meets up for a chat and a cocktail before dinner.   Grounds are really quiet and enjoyable with much wildlife to watch (including some entertaining but well behaved - as far as we saw - monkeys!) 
Food:   As mentioned above - really great selection and interesting options - always changing.   A good light lunch menu or snacks selection are also available.  The food is not cheap but excellent freshly cooked quality and generous portions so I would say very fairly priced.  We so enjoyed it we never ate at the local eateries.   Good cocktail selections.  
Team:  Well you cannot fault any of the staff.  All of the team but especially the two lead managers Umesh and Kalpa were always on hand and ready to solve any problems.   

This review is so glowing I thought I ought to try and find some down sides!! If you want to swim in the sea everyday it is a bit of walk.  But to sit and listen to the waves and watch the sea - it is fine.
title: A Place it is difficult to fault - we loved it!

roomTip: Just go !
text:
First time to Sri Lanka,  so we were unsure of where to stay and how to experience the best service and hospitality it had to offer. After meeting with friends who had been on several previous occasions they insisted that there was only one choice - Buckingham Place. We arrived after a long journey from Manchester via Doha to be what can only be described as the warmest welcome we have ever received. The hotel is without doubt one of the most beautiful and friendly places we have ever visited. Nick (the owner) is quite simply unique and his style of hotel management is refreshing and very professional. He engages with every guest on a daily basis and his team ensure that your stay is the most relaxing and trouble free holiday possible. The food and drinks service are superb with an ever changing menu.  Our villa (10) was arguably the largest well appointed room we have ever had the pleasure of staying in. The view over the lagoon was spectacular with the Sri Lankan  wildlife performing a daily spectacle that was a pleasure to behold. The hotel offers guests a truly wonderful experience and we would have absolutely no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this fantastic place to guests wanting a relaxing and rewarding stay. Well done Nick, well done all of the team, you really have cracked it.

Best wishes and we look forward to seeing you all again.

Paul & Catherine Taylor
title: Five Stars is not enough !!

roomTip: There's plenty of space at both of the two pools and excellent wifi.
text:
For me, this was the best place I stayed in Sri Lanka and everywhere we stayed was wonderful. But Buckingham Place just edged it as being one of the best places I've ever stayed. 
We were fortunate to be staying in the suite rooms, which all have their own private gardens and verandas, where we sat and watched the kites wheeling over the lagoon - simply wonderful.
The rooms were fantastic, very large and comfortable and with the best outdoor bathrooms, with both waterfall shower and very large and inviting bathtub. 
The food was absolutely superb; top quality, beautifully presented and abundant. It was the best food we had in Sri Lanka, and that's saying something as Sri Lankan cuisine is wonderful.
The owner, Nick, (very interesting person and a great hotelier) told us to order as many courses as we liked for breakfast. So we did!
Service was faultless and very friendly.
The location can't be beaten with a private path down to the idyllic beach. We went turtle watching at night  on the beach and were lucky to see a turtle laying her eggs. 
We all agreed that we would have liked a much longer stay and really hope to return. 
I can't recommend Buckingham Place highly enough.
title: Absolutely fabulous!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '938339013', 'text': 'Huge fun!

This being a small boutique property, rarely do we find ourselves hosting large touring groups. However, we were absolutely delighted to do so and for 3 days we could not have enjoyed ourselves more. Despite stretching us a little more than we realised we could be, there wasn’t a single moment we didn’t have a smile on our face or want to do more for you. That ours was the perfect place to relax and the best hotel you stayed at in Sri Lanka is awesome, and puts that smile back on our faces. Your amazing review is ‘pinging’ on every team members telephone this morning! 

So, thank you for being such great fun to have around the place and, for your overwhelming respect for us and other guests staying at the time. As for telling us you’ll definitely be back? It will be a pleasure and privalege to be at your service any time – preferably for a longer stay?? 
 
Finally, thank you for your valuable good custom and review, both contribute to sustaining more than 50 local families as well as my own life here.

Until we meet again… good wishes and happy travels to you all.

Our warm regards and thanks,  
  
Nick & the Team

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Stay at least 3 days!
text: We, a group of 17 friends who have been traveling together for many years, stayed at Buckingham Place at the end of a wonderful trip through Sri Lanka. We all agreed it was the best hotel, the perfect place to relax after 2 very busy weeks. The hotel, the rooms, the infinity pool, everything was just perfect! Nick, Kalpa and their  team made us feel very welcome right from the start. Always with smiles…. The food was exceptional. Every dish we were served was amazing….. We were all sorry to leave…. Will definitely be back.
title: The best hotel we stayed at in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse:
{'id': '938339575', 'text': 'A truly thoughtful review – thank you.

Many thanks for coming to stay and for such an awesome thumbs up. It was a pleasure to host all of you and, I was very touched by your genuine interest in the history and background of the hotel, and my own story.

Seeing guests get the best from the hotel, made possible by a team that embodies its ethos ‘nothing is too much trouble’, is the most rewarding element of my role here. I am too often commended for my input but thank you graciously for doing so, but really it is the hard work and diligence of a team of Sri Lankans (currently 53) that ensures the place runs like clockwork, a team that cares for every guest as if they were their own family. We tell everyone, everything is meant to be perfect. The sentiment is heartfelt not a slogan, but in a less than perfect world challenges inevitably arise to test us all. Whenever they do nobody rests, not until that challenge is met and put to bed, just as you experienced yourselves. To work with a team so committed is a joy, one not experienced until I became an hotelier in Sri Lanka.

Thank you for your empathy and respect for all of us, and thank you for being super sociable guests we’d be thrilled to welcome back. Please do join the ever growing community of fabulous folk who return year after year, people whom have become friends of Buckingham Place if only to see our latest colours every couple of years or so! I promise as many mango milkshakes for your son as he can drink, and first cocktails on the house the moment you arrive!!     

Thank you for your valuable good custom and belief, and moreover, your excellent good company.

Until next time.. I wish you safe and happy travels and a blissfully happy life..   

Warm regards and respect

Nick & the Team
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-14', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Go on a sunrise or sunset rafting tour at the Kalametiya Bird Sanctuary. It’s such a tranquil experience.
text:
Thank you Nick, Kalpa, Umesh and the whole team for a wonderful few days at your hotel. 

The setting is picture perfect, with the glorious infinity pool overlooking the ocean. The beach is breathtaking and beautifully wild. The food is delicious and made with love, and the rooms are huge, spotlessly clean and comfortable. You can do absolutely nothing or go out and explore, there’s no pressure either way. 

However, what really sets this hotel apart are the people who work here and the guests who stay. Nick and his team are thoughtful, kind, generous and the happiest, most welcoming team we’ve experienced. From the tuk tuk drivers and housekeeping staff to the waiters and management team, everyone has a warm smile and seems genuinely happy to work here.

They’ve completely perfected a personal and attentive yet unobtrusive service, together with a home-from-home ambience. Everything is done from the heart.

And the guests, many returning year after year, are all so friendly and down to earth. I spent my birthday here and not only did the team decorate the breakfast table beautifully, all personally sign a handmade card and produce a gorgeous cake, almost every guest wished me a happy birthday. 

If you’re in doubt about the slightly eccentric decor, give it a go because a few days spent here is guaranteed to brighten your world.

Thank you again to Nick, Kalpa, Umesh and the whole team for making us and our two children so welcome. And thanks to Bella and Gracie, the resident dogs for all the cuddles, too.
title: A truly thoughtful hotel

ownerResponse:
{'id': '936898515', 'text': 'Awesome guests – missing you already!

I proudly boast we have the best guest lists on the island. Perhaps I should add ‘probably’ so as not to upset fellow hoteliers but I won’t, as there can’t possibly be anywhere you stay that couldn’t make that same proud boast with all 4 of you in the house.

I reply to you all with the same message, not because I’m lazy (I can be!) but because as a ‘team’ you added magic to our week. You’ll get out of life what you put in someone said, and with you all it’ll be your great zest for life. If the hotel was special it’s because you made it so, simply by putting smiles on others faces before they you. To write anything else to any of you for the sake of it would be nonsensical. No matter how hard we worked or how many champagne corks you made us pop, we enjoyed your stay immensely and will remember it, and were sad when you moved on too soon. It was as if you’d joined our ever expanding ‘friends of Buckingham Place’ club long ago!        

Your empathy for the team and respect for us and other guests was a master-class. Thank you for this and your seriously good custom of course, plus, the two spectacular reviews. Much respect and admiration also, for the massive hole you left in our champagne and wine stocks!!

You were awesome, and by now you must know we’d welcome you back as soon as you can get here. Until then, have a wonderful year and blissfully happy lives. We look forward to seeing you again - please get planning!!!

Thanks for the privalege and pleasure...

Fond regards

Hugs

Nick & the Team   
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-04', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Try and go between February to April so that you can see the Turtles laying their eggs on the beach.
text:
All I can say is Wow!

From the moment we arrived, we were met with smiles and it was really pleasing to see that Nick (the owner) was as passionate about the place as we were. 

The rooms (ours was 102) were spectacular, with a superb bathroom and shower with loads of room. 

The hotel is decorated with Nicks flair and it is clear that a lot of thought has gone into the layout and overall ambience. 

The food was great and unusually for Sri Lanka had a great wine selection. 

We have never returned to a hotel before, however we are already planning our next trip to see this great hotel.
title: A fantastic stay at Buckingham Place

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Make sure you go down to the beach at night to see nesting turtles. Amazing experience
text:
Without doubt on the most exceptional hotels we have ever stayed in. I genuinely cannot think of anything to fault. We stayed for three nights and barely left the hotel. The rooms are truly enormous with bathrooms bigger than most hotel rooms. The food is fantastic and creative with the dinner menu changing daily. Excellent drinks selection all offered by incredibly professional and friendly staff. 

There are also lots of little extras here, a nice games room, two stunning pools, occasional complimentary drink by the pool. But also  it is a very sociable (if you want it) hotel with the pool bar a great place to chat to other guests. 

The charming owner is regularly around which is probably why everything is so perfect . We will definitely come back.

One word - fabulous.
title: A truly fabulous hotel

ownerResponse:
{'id': '936668588', 'text': 'Thank you again (and again!)…

Not often do I get an opportunity to thank a guest for their review in person, but just occasionally, like you, their enthusiasm for the hotel inspires a real corker of one before they leave! Thank you again for yours, I was absolutely bowled over reading it this morning, just as we all were to welcome you back. I’m about to share your kind words with the team but thank you now on everybody’s behalf.

To read, “….no hotel has ever matched Buckingham Place” is a truly wonderful compliment - thank you. However, for your sakes I hope every hotel will do so henceforth, in between staying with us that is!! That you have come back is the ultimate accolade, so thank you for doing so and, for bringing your smashing good company and valuable custom back to us.

It is a beautiful sunny morning and you have a couple more days before you move on. I hope they are every bit as enjoyable as they have been so far, especially today on your wife’s birthday!

Thanks (again!) for making our day…

Fond regards and respect

Nick and the Team  
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-02', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}

roomTip:
Just relax and enjoy this wonderful place.

Recommended visit: kalametiyabirds.com, 30 minutes by car.  Unmissable gem.
text:
This is our 2nd stay at our favourite hotel ever. Perfection in a hotel. This is how to design, build and run a hotel. Everything is perfect, luxury at a non-luxury price. It helps to be situated next to the ocean. The staff are wonderful, with everything done in a friendly but professional way. Nothing is too much trouble (a Sri Lankan trait) and all delivered with that ever-present Sri Lankan smile. 

In our experience, no hotel has ever matched Buckingham Place.
title: Repeat visit to this wonderful hotel

ownerResponse:
{'id': '936479830', 'text': 'Lovely laid-back Latvians!

Thank you for coming to stay, and for supporting and humbling us all with great praise. You were a joy to host for every moment of your stay, both for the team and me personally, it was a pleasure to meet and chat away with you whenever the opportunity arose. 

I would be fascinated to learn more about your country, and so hopefully you will return and others will come – indeed another Latvian couple arrive later today! In case any of your fellow country men and women read this, a warm welcome awaits you throughout Sri Lanka and at Buckingham Place – a big hello to the too few who have discovered us already!

Thank you again, for your valuable good custom and this perfect review. I am delighted you found sanctuary with us and that we exceeded your expectations; that you could relax, unwind and enjoy being here as I do was so nice so see. Thanks for your kind respect for and appreciation of my team, it would be a pleasure and privalege to welcome you back.     

Until next time I hope? I wish you a mild winter and much happiness through 2024.

Warm regards and respect,

Nick & the Team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-31', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text:
We arrived at the property rather tired after a lengthy "marathon" through Sri Lanka touristy hot spots. We find this place to suit our relaxing needs perfectly - no crowds around, no scream noises, no rush. The soothing white noise by background ocean waves, wind, trees, birds! The surrounding beach, the actual place, the well planned, spotless buildings and structures, delicious (delicious, indeed) meals, the professional, attentive, yet not disturbing staff - what can be better than this! And, at the centre of it all - Nick, the owner - such a charismatic person, a pleasure to meet and talk, thank you!
The Buckingham Place far exceeded our initial expectations, we based on previously read great reviews.
title: The ideal place for a peaceful vacation

ownerResponse:
{'id': '934737370', 'text': 'A delightful family…

Thank you very much indeed for your support here on Trip Advisor, on Google and via your own social media. Yours is a delightful family to host, and whilst you spent much of your stay exploring the area, when we did meet it was always a pleasure. 

Your enthusiasm for the hotel and what we do here touched all of us.  

Your compliments for the hotel have already inspired a last minute booking – thank you! I’m sure many more will follow in your footsteps. Your feedback is much appreciated as is your valuable custom, good company and respect for myself and the team. Also, I couldn’t help but be impressed by your thoughtful respect for other guests. Using our smaller swimming pool so your kids could be kids without disturbing them was appreciated by all, to the extent other guests complimented you for doing so.

“We will come back for sure” are the most rewarding and reassuring words we could wish to read and a high accolade for any hotelier and his or her team. It could go without saying (but I will!) your family will always find a warm welcome at Buckingham Place so yes please - do come back!!

Thank you, best wishes to you and all our friends in Poland..

Warm regards and respect

ownerResponse:

As I reply to you, your eloquent review is bringing smiles to those working tirelessly to give everyone a memorable stay. In so doing, almost effortlessly, they showcase Sri Lanka’s legendary welcome and natural spirit of hospitality. So again thank you, for sharing your experience of being here with the World - and special thanks for humbling me personally and for giving our General Manager some much deserved recognition.

Nick, Kalpa & the Team

placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
text:
Buckingham Place is an oasis in Sri Lanka (itself a stunningly beautiful country), a place to go if you seek a quiet relaxing time with anything you could possibly wish for. Boasting a large infinity pool, swim up bar, restaurant and the most helpful / accommodating staff, I promise you will have the best time. Not to
mention the rooms which are impressively large, especially the outdoor bathrooms with stunning views. Kalpa (the general manager) & Nick (owner) make you feel right at home from the start, and we wished we didn’t have to go home at the end! As it was our first visit, the large number of returning guests staying there during our stay only serves to illustrate the common held feeling of all guests - what a unique and wonderful hotel!
title: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '932804386', 'text': 'I’d better get some Carlsberg in!

New Year Eve - a house-full of fabulous guests ready to party and a team on fine form, what could possibly go wrong? Torrential rain maybe?? Luckily it held off, and with Plan B up our sleeve we kept calm and carried on! Thanks to the ingenuity of a determined, incredibly hard working team, and that nights remarkably adaptive cast of performers, a night to remember for many years to come albeit sans Carlsberg, was had by all – even us old folk danced (almost) ‘til dawn.

Whilst with us and unprompted, you astutely recognized it is the team that makes the hotel tick, not only through its good natured hard work, but with pride and what I can only describe as a natural spirit of hospitality. Unusual these days maybe, but the team actually do care for guests as I do, there’s no catch and, it comes straight from the heart. I say with no false modesty, that I wish every guest looked through the same lens, and gave more recognition to the ones working daylong on their feet in a tropical climate, being spoken to in every language but their own! It is not quite as effortless as they make it look.
 
You underlined your humanity by recognizing what should be, and, were standout guests in every way, all of you. You were huge fun, and as sociable as guests get, so thank you for choosing to see the new year in at Buckingham Place, and arriving a week early to do so. Your valuable custom is much appreciated as is your empathy for my team - your stonking review is the cherry on the cake. 

I hope I have been unambiguous, we really would be thrilled to welcome you back, the sooner the better please!

Thank you. 

Happy New Year!
Nick and the Team  
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-07', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: It's a great place that really wants to make your holiday as stress free as possible.
text:
There are only 16 rooms, so no need to worry about space by the pool etc. There is no such thing as a queue in this place ever. Our room  seemed luxurious, looking out over the lagoon, with an amazingly spacious bathroom fitted with walk in shower and bidet.

The delight in staying here is in the attention to detail of the small things that make the difference between a nice place to stay and a great place to stay.

For example, if you (or Carlsberg) were thinking about a swimming pool in your hotel you might want a deep end for diving and a good length for the sporty types. But an infinity pool view would be nice overlooking the sea. How about a shallow end which connects to the bar where you can sit in stools in the pool enjoying drinks? All sorted!

If your guests don't want to get up early for breakfast why not offer it all morning, and allow them to order as many dishes as they want all inclusive?

The overwhelming factor that makes this such a great place to stay is the staff. It is a credit to the owner Nick and his team to have such a great ethos of wanting to make it the best holiday for you. The term nothing is too much trouble is overused but completely apposite here. Try challenging them by asking for a cocktail not on the bar menu or food not on the dinner menu and they will rise to the challenge with a smile. 

New Years evening was special. I was told Christmas day was not to be missed.

Would wholly recommend.
title: Agree with Damien if Carlsberg did...

ownerResponse:
{'id': '932351566', 'text': '
9 years on, as much fun as ever!

Upon meeting you this time, admittedly whilst scrabbling to match names to your faces, I recalled fun memories of your stay 9 years ago. I could not believe our luck this time! Knowing you’d enter into the spirit from the off, having you on our Christmas guest list guaranteed it would be a happy one - you did not disappoint! Christmas ’23 for me ranks as one of the happiest celebrations at the hotel, if not the happiest - and the most fun!  So, thank you for coming back and joining in, and for the moments that made me forget I was meant to be working hard with the team!

Your eloquent review is knockout, touching on just about every aspect of what it’s like to be here. Those of us whom have read it are thrilled to bits and I have just shared it with the rest of team and send thanks from everyone. Your kind words for what we’ve done with the place, how you feel about it and, how the entire team stepped up to cook, care and serve you are second to none. It was great to read also, you enjoy what I do by living here, wildlife so abundant it is hard to imagine!

Thank you honestly and warmly for coming back, for bringing valuable custom to us and, being such great sports - all of you. 
Finally, thanks for painting a beautiful picture of paradise then pinning pictures to it, and sharing it with the world on Trip Advisor.

Please do come again, but just don’t leave it another 9 years?!

Warm regards and respect, 
Nick & the Team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-04', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
placeInfo: {'id': '1943029', 'name': 'Buckingham Place', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1184, 'locationString': 'Rekawa, Netolpitiya, Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.047304, 'longitude': 80.855316, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2260795-d1943029-Reviews-Buckingham_Place-Rekawa_Netolpitiya_Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://buckinghamplace.lk/', 'address': 'Rekawa Beach Road Rekawa Village, Rekawa, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rekawa Beach Road', 'street2': 'Rekawa Village', 'city': 'Rekawa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 9, 'count4': 30, 'count5': 1143}}
roomTip: Take your binoculars as well as some ‘Off!’ and you’ll have a ball. Tuk Tuk into the village for devilled prawns on the beach.
text:
We were lucky enough to revisit Buckingham Place a few days ago. We had first visited with a bunch of couples celebrating my 50th birthday nearly 9 years ago. Since then there’s been one thing after another hindering Sri Lanka’s return to the levels of tourism it and its wonderful folk so dearly deserve.
In the interim we have been to other places in the island but we were absolutely knocked out by how fantastic this place is now. The key addition is the old kitchen and restaurant are now a Spa because Nick has built an amazing new bar and restaurant with a huge infinity pool. This area opens up the view of the beach and ocean behind it and it really is stunning. You can look out to sea from the pool or sit back at the bar and restaurant and the view across them both hard to believe. This new area is a 5 minute walk from our beautifully finished room that looks out to the other side of the resort that’s a wonderful lagoon with eagles soaring and monkeys in the trees. Pics of both views attached. Combining  these views with the best food we’ve enjoyed in our 8 trips to Sri Lanka and friendly service of the highest order blew our minds and we can’t wait to go back a third time. Btw, the food and the service were fantastic back 9 years ago and the long-retained staff just seem to go from strength to strength. We were exceptionally lucky enough to enjoy Christmas lunch this trip and it was as lovely as we’ve ever had, anywhere.
This resort is just so special because as well as the luxury of all of the above the whole area is a small nature reserve. In just a few moments walk from the front gate we saw water buffalos bathing, kingfishers feeding, peacocks spreading their tail feathers, monkey’s swinging and eagles floating on the thermals.
Thank you Nick, Kalpa and the whole team. We won’t leave it so long next time!
title: Going back was better than ever!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '932218528', 'text': 'Happy New Year, and thank you for our first review and fab photos of the year! 
 
To read, you found the hotel a perfect place to relax is a delight. This is exactly what we aim for it to be, a sanctuary for those who wish to simply kick off their shoes and while away a week or so at a slower pace than life. 

I’m delighted the team were as attentive as ever and that you enjoyed our cuisine, but what is so reassuring to note and is of invaluable importance to those in your footsteps, as every guest should feel, you felt safe and respected as a solo female traveler. I often travel solo and even as a male find this is not always the case, often at restaurants where one can feel an ‘inconvenience’ or oddity even!

We all enjoyed hosting you - you could not have made it more pleasant or easy for us. Thank you for this and your valuable good custom and company, and again, for our first (and perfect) review for 2024.  

I hope you will return one day, in the meantime I wish you happy travels and, a blissfully happy life!

Thank you.

Warm regards and respect

Nick & the Team  ', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-03', 'responder': 'Buckingham Place', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}

text:
A slightly corporate welcome but once we were taken through the complex everything was very well maintained and the staff were incredibly friendly from this point. Our room was very clean and modern. 

We had a slight issue with the shower drainage but this was fixed on request. The real draw is the picturesque beach, the best we’d seen on our trip! It really is paradise! Tasty breakfast, beautiful beach and very friendly staff made our stay here.

placeInfo: {'id': '447369', 'name': 'Palm Paradise Cabanas & Villas Beach Resort Tangalle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1071, 'locationString': 'Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.010168, 'longitude': 80.77962, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304142-d447369-Reviews-Palm_Paradise_Cabanas_Villas_Beach_Resort_Tangalle-Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.beach.lk', 'address': 'Hambantota Main Road Goyambokka, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hambantota Main Road', 'street2': 'Goyambokka', 'city': 'Tangalle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 41, 'count3': 100, 'count4': 255, 'count5': 640}}
text:
Returning to Palm Paradise after a four year gap, it remains a lovely place to stay.  This time, we stayed for two nights in the most luxurious villa for four people before moving to a  'country house room' for six nights, which although simpler was still very comfortable.  Four years ago we enjoyed the sea breezes in a cabana.
The beach is a delight and wasn't too crowded whilst we were there.  The waves were quite lively but when we tired of the beach we enjoyed retiring to the lovely, if oddly shaped, swimming pool.  The well-cared for gardens and the birds they attract are a delight.
Breakfast was delicious, particularly the toast, and a bonus was being able to try the restaurants on the beach and along the lane to Goyambokka.
The resort very efficiently organised a couple of trips for us - a tuc tuc ride to the atmospheric Mulkirigala Temple (go early in the morning) and an evening taxi/boat trip to the Kalematiya Bird Reserve.  Tangalle is a short tuc tuc ride away for shopping and visiting the fishing harbour.
title: The best toast in Sri Lanka

placeInfo: {'id': '447369', 'name': 'Palm Paradise Cabanas & Villas Beach Resort Tangalle', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1071, 'locationString': 'Tangalle, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.010168, 'longitude': 80.77962, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304142-d447369-Reviews-Palm_Paradise_Cabanas_Villas_Beach_Resort_Tangalle-Tangalle_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.beach.lk', 'address': 'Hambantota Main Road Goyambokka, Tangalle 82200 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hambantota Main Road', 'street2': 'Goyambokka', 'city': 'Tangalle', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82200'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 41, 'count3': 100, 'count4': 255, 'count5': 640}}
roomTip: Look beyond the check-in, and you’ll find a hidden gem.
text:
Firstly, the location is absolutely amazing. The beach bay is pristine, offering a serene escape from crowded tourist spots. The opportunity for endless body surfing made my stay truly enjoyable.

A pleasant surprise was discovering that the restaurant is primarily managed by Sri Lankan locals, not the German owners.

Palm Paradise Cabanas and Villas is a hidden gem. The beautiful location, the welcoming local staff, and the restaurant’s culinary delights make it a recommended stay, despite the less-than-friendly German owners. No hospitality skills .

Support the locals.
title: Beach hidden gem.
